question: A country is said to be in debt trap in which of the following situations?
option1: It has to abide by the conditionalities imposed by the International Monetary Fund
option2: It has to borrow to make interest payments to on outstanding loans
option3: It has been refused loans or aid by creditors abroad
option4: The World Bank charges a very high rate of interest on outstanding as well as new loans
answer: It has to borrow to make interest payments to on outstanding loans
explanation: Debt Trap a situation in which a debt is difficult or impossible to repay, typically because high interest payments prevent repayment of the principal. A country is said to be in debt trap if it has to borrow to make interest payments to on outstanding loans.
